title_sort: walt whitman to anne gilchrist, 25 september [1877]
title: Walt Whitman to Anne Gilchrist, 25 September [1877]
text: 431 Stevens StreetCamdenSeptSeptember 25Dearest friendBee's card rec'dreceived this morning—glad & thankful to hear all is going well with you—have abstained from coming over, for fear of being in the way—but hope I may come soon—Mannahatta and Jessie went off in the 11:45 train from Phil:Philadelphia to-daytoday—in good spirits, & excellent well, and have had a jolly good visit both to you & yours & over here—My sister is well—She went over with the girls to the depot—saw them off safely, & returned to dinner—No further news rec'dreceived by me from Herby—I am well as usual—doing nothing particular—W.W. Walt Whitman to Anne Gilchrist, 25 September [1877]
